raw_text:
EastEnders 'is set for US remake'
 
 Plans to create a US soap based on the BBC's EastEnders have reportedly been drawn up by the Fox TV network.
 
 EastEnders' head writer Tony Jordan and music mogul Simon Fuller are involved in the project, according to reports in the Hollywood Reporter trade newspaper. It said scripts have been commissioned for a series about a community of working class people in of Chicago. The original EastEnders was pulled from BBC America last year after it proved a failure in the ratings. US versions of other British hits have proved less successful across the Atlantic.
 
 BBC comedy Coupling was remade with a US cast, but lost its primetime slot on the NBC network due to disappointing ratings. At home, EastEnders has been facing its own ratings battle, recently losing out to rival ITV soap Emmer dale. Primetime soaps on US television have made a recent comeback, following the success of ABC serial Desperate Housewives. The series takes a "darkly comedic" look at the goings-on of a group of characters living in the suburbs.
llama3.2:1b: EastEnders is set for a US remake and will feature scripts commissioned by Fox TV network's head writer Tony Jordan and music mogul Simon Fuller, based on the BBC original series featuring a working-class community in Chicago.
llama3.2:3b: BBC's EastEnders is reportedly being remade as a US soap by Fox TV with Tony Jordan and Simon Fuller involved, scripts commissioned for a show about working-class people in Chicago, despite previous UK adaptations failing in the US and similar British shows experiencing low ratings.
gemma2:2b: Fox TV plans a US remake of the British soap opera EastEnders, involving writer Tony Jordan and music mogul Simon Fuller.
The show will center on working class people in Chicago and follows the original's themes.
Past attempts to adapt British shows for American audiences, like Coupling, haven't been as successful.

This would be the first major British series remade in America since Coupling, which faced similar issues.

stablelm2:1.6b: The BBC's "EastEnders" is reportedly set for a US remake by Fox TV network, with head writer Tony Jordan and music mogul Simon Fuller involved.
The project will focus on a community of working-class people in Chicago, with scripts commissioned for a show about them.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Fox TV is reportedly developing a US remake of EastEnders, based on the BBC's popular British soap set in London's East End.
The project involves head writer Tony Jordan and music executive Simon Fuller.
The series will feature a working-class community in Chicago, mirroring the original's focus on a diverse ensemble.
Despite initial plans to air it on BBC America, the show was cancelled due to poor ratings.
Previous US remakes of British hits, such as Coupling and Desperate Housewives, have also faced challenges in maintaining their primetime spots.
EastEnders itself has been experiencing domestic viewership struggles against rival ITV soap Emmerdale.
The new EastEnders aims to adopt a darkly comedic tone similar to Desperate Housewives, which has recently seen a resurgence in US primetime soaps.
